text:
View 1: Joyce Kilmer Park, Bronx. Looking north from East 161 Street and Grand Concourse, showing the Heinrich Heine statue in the foreground.
View 2: Another view of the Park, from E. 162 St., after it had been rebuilt by the W.P.A.

View 1: May 16, 1928
P. L. Sperr, photographer
View 2: May 11, 1937
W.P.A. photo, Five Boroughs Project
title: Bronx: 161st Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:

title: Bronx: 161st Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
East 161st Street, at Grand Concourse, showing sidewalk repair work conducted by the W.P.A. In the background appear the lower floors of the Concourse Plaza, at the N.E. corner of the two thoroughfares.

December 3, 1936.

Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.
title: Bronx: 161st Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
1. 900 Grand Concourse, east side, north from East 161st to 162nd Streets, showing the Concourse Plaza. In the foreground, where automobiles are seen, is East 161st Street.

July 7, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

2. Grand Concourse bet. 162nd & 161st St.
Concourse Plaza Hotel. Neg. A-2 April 10, 1941
P.L. Sperr, photographer
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 161st Street (East)

text:
1. 900 Grand Concourse, east side, north from East 161st to 162nd Streets, showing the Concourse Plaza. In the foreground, where automobiles are seen, is East 161st Street.

July 7, 1936.

2. Grand Concourse bet. 162nd & 161st St.
Concourse Plaza Hotel. Neg. A-2 April 10, 1941

title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 161st Street (East)

text:
Grand Concourse, at East 161st Street. The W.P.A. workmen are working on the S.W. corner of the two thoroughfares, near the County Court House.

Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.

December 3, 1936.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 161st Street (East)

text:
Grand Concourse (running from extreme right foreground to center background), north from and including East 161st to a point north of 164th Streets. In the foreground is East 161st Street from Grand Concourse to Walton Ave. and part of Joyce Kilmer Park.

July 7, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 161st Street (East)

text:
(1) East 161st Street, at the south east corner of Grand Concourse, viewing east and showing a rocky bluff where apartment houses were later erected.

(2) shows a modern apartment building going up on the corner.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: July 7, 1936
View 2: April 10, 1941
